class Loop.PhotonPolarization(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

Photons of type COMP in the dual rail enconding can either correspond to the Horizontal or Vertical polarization in the polarization enconding.

H = 'H'
NONE = '99'
V = 'V'
class Loop.PhotonType(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

There are three possible types of photons. 1) Photons that belong to a qubit (COMPutational photons), 2) Photons that will be witnessed (WITNESS), 3) Everything else. Photons of type COMP will always have a corresponding Qubit object and a corresponding polariation Horizontal or Vertical. Photon of type WITNESS will always have a out_state.

COMP = 'COMP'
NONE = '99'
WITNESS = 'WITNESS'
class Loop.Qbit(pos, logical=False)[source]

Loop.check(photons, o, logical=True, witness=True)[source]

Check if a string of 0s and 1s o corresponds to a logical string and/or the photons of type witness are witnessed correctly.

Parameters:

  • photons (list of Photon) – list of photons to check

  • o (list of int) – the string of 0s and 1s to check

  • logical (bool, optional) – decide to check if the string is logical or not, defaults to True

  • witness (bool, optional) – decide to check if the photons of type witness must be checked or not, defaults to True

Returns:

return True if the string o corresponds to the dual rail enconding of the list photons

Return type:

bool

Loop.format_logical(qbits, state)[source]

Given a set of qubits and a state state, it returns a dictionary mapping every qubit to the corresponding logical state.

Parameters:

  • qbits (list of Qubit) – list of qubits

  • state (list of int) – a Fock state

Returns:

a dictionary mapping every qubit to False or True

Return type:

dict

Loop.partition(n, m)[source]

Return a list of all the possible partitions of m elements in n bins.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – number of bins

  • m (int) – number of elements to partition

Returns:

list of all the possible partitions

Return type:

list of list

Loop.photon_from_position(photons, pos)[source]

Return the photon with position pos in a list of photons.

Parameters:

  • photons (list of Photon) – list of photons

  • pos (int) – position of the photon in the photonic circuit

Returns:

photon in position pos

Return type:

Photon
